author: David Gauthier-Villars
title: At the Pyeongchang Games: Where’s the Party?
text:
GANGNEUNG, South Korea—Pavel Sechin comes from Russia’s Siberian region of Yakutia, known for its giant idle diamond mine and extreme isolation.
After five days at the Pyeongchang Olympics, he had an opinion that would not budge: “Outside from competitions, there is nothing to do. It’s very boring here.”

On Wednesday night at 11 p.m., the...
